definition: (of yamen bailiffs etc) to walk ahead of an official, shouting at pedestrians to clear the way

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
to clear a street by banging gongs and shouting loudly (idiom)

sentences.english: He had him ride in a chariot as his second-in-command, and men shouted before him, "Make way! ""
sentences.chinese: 又叫約瑟坐他的副車，喝道的在前呼叫說，跪下。

sentences.english: Changing to English, Hans snapped, "Take off his coat and shirt."
sentences.chinese: 漢斯突然用英語喝道，“剝了他的大衣和襯衣。”

definition: to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 呵斥[he1 chi4]
to desist/to stop/to stay one's hand
to glower (at sb)/to cast an angry look
to shout an order or command
to sneer/to laugh grimly/grin of dissatisfaction (bitterness, helplessness, indignation etc)/bitter, grim, sarcastic or angry smile
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 喝斥[he1 chi4]
